pt: {sc}likeness{/sc} {sc}similarity{/sc} {sc}resemblance{/sc} {sc}similitude{/sc} {sc}analogy{/sc} mean agreement or correspondence in details. {sc}likeness{/sc} implies a closer correspondence than {sc}similarity{/sc} which often implies that things are merely somewhat alike.

pt.t: a remarkable {it}likeness{/it} to his late father

pt: {sc}resemblance{/sc} implies similarity chiefly in appearance or external qualities.

pt.t: statements that bear little {it}resemblance{/it} to the truth

pt: {sc}similitude{/sc} applies chiefly to correspondence between abstractions.

pt.t: two schools of social thought showing points of {it}similitude{/it}

pt: {sc}analogy{/sc} implies likeness or parallelism in relations rather than in appearance or qualities.

shortdef: the quality or state of being similar : resemblance

dt: {bc}the quality or state of having an appearance that is invariant upon being scaled larger or smaller

dt.t: magnify the fractal and you can see the {wi}self-similarity{/wi} of its edge

shortdef: the quality or state of having an appearance that is invariant upon being scaled larger or smaller

dt: used to say that besides some specified thing or things that two people or things have in common, the two are not alike in other ways

dt.t: Both women have two children and like sports but {it}there the similarity ends{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that besides some specified thing or things that two people or things have in common, the two are not alike in other ways
